tool_description: Systematically identifies and catalogs physical barriers that impede accessibility for people with various disabilities throughout the building environment.

assessment_scope.description: Areas to assess: entrance, interior_routes, restrooms, parking, elevators, stairs, signage, lighting, surfaces, doors

disability_perspectives.description: Disability considerations: mobility, visual, hearing, cognitive, dexterity, speech, multiple

barrier_severity.description: Minimum severity to report: minor, moderate, major, critical

error_messages: Invalid building ID: Provide a valid building identifier from the assessment system.
Unsupported assessment scope: Use only recognized building areas from the specified list.
Invalid disability perspective: Use recognized disability categories from the provided options.
Incorrect severity level: Choose from minor, moderate, major, or critical severity levels.
usage: Specify building and scope of assessment, including which disability perspectives to consider. The tool identifies barriers based on universal design principles and accessibility standards.

barrier_assessment_id.description: Unique identifier for this barrier identification session

total_barriers_found.description: Total number of accessibility barriers identified

barrier_locations.description: Specific locations where barriers were identified

severity_breakdown.description: Count of barriers by severity level

affected_populations.description: Disability groups most impacted by identified barriers
